diff_hunk:
@@ -193,24 +193,46 @@ def unused(g):
 
 
 @parse_args('v', 'v', 't')
-def add(g, self, other, alpha):
+def _add_alpha(g, self, other, alpha):
     if _scalar(alpha) != 1:
         return _unimplemented("add", "alpha != 1")
     # See Note [Pointwise by scalar]
     other = _maybe_get_scalar(other)
     return g.op("Add", self, _if_scalar_type_as(g, other, self))
 
 
+@parse_args('v', 'v')
+def _add(g, self, other):
+    other = _maybe_get_scalar(other)
+    return g.op("Add", self, _if_scalar_type_as(g, other, self))
+
+
+def add(g, *args):
body:
*args is confusing. Can we give a default value to alpha, so we only have one function:
`def add(g, self, other, alpha=None)`
